contract_verification.common.abi_alert: Note: Contract with custom ABI is only meant for debugging purpose and it is the user’s responsibility to ensure that the provided ABI matches the contract, otherwise errors may occur or results returned may be incorrect.Blockscout is not responsible for any losses that arise from the use of Read & Write contract.
contract_verification.common.methods_loa: Add custom ABIs for this contract and access when logged into your account. Helpful for debugging,functional testing and contract interaction.

contract_verification.common.the_crate_s: The crate should be located in the root directory. If it is not the case, please specify the relative path from the root to the crate directory.
contract_verification.common.primary_com: Primary compiled Vyper contract. Only add the main contract here whose bytecode has been deployed, all other files can be uploaded to the interfaces box below.
contract_verification.common.if_your_cod: If your code utilizes a library or inherits dependencies, we recommend using other verification methods instead.

contract_verification.common.the_compile: The compiler version is specified in
contract_verification.common.use_the_com: . Use the compiler version rather than the nightly build. If using the Solidity compiler, run
contract_verification.common.if_required: if required by the contract. Constructor arguments are written right to left, and will be found at the end of the input created bytecode.
contract_verification.common.the_evm_ver: The EVM version the contract is written for. If the bytecode does not match the version, we try to verify using the latest EVM version.
contract_verification.common.a_library_n: A library name called in the .sol file. Multiple libraries (up to 10) may be added for each contract.
contract_verification.common.the_0x_libr: The 0x library address. This can be found in the generated json file or Truffle output (if using truffle).
